page.title: 05Mersey Valley Ranger Service
page.content: There are about 70 Rangers funded by the Mersey Valley Partnership and the Manpower Services Commission. The Service is aimed at making people in the Mersey Valley area aware of their surroundings,to take a pride in them and to actively help in restoring an area previously ravaged by industrial development. In locations like Spike Island, Runcorn Hill and Pickerings Pasture Rangers help organise events to get people to use and appreciate these open spaces.They patrol and maintain these areas and act as guides.Local people are invited to help in such activities as tree planting,restoring wildlife habitats,clearing and improv_ ing paths and stretches of water. Young people can become Ranger Helpers on many of these projects.
